image.altText: Two women in protective gear and gloves in a lab. One researcher holds a dropper on a table full of beakers.

items.synopsis: Researchers are on the cusp of creating a vaccine to fend off bacterial ear infections in children.

title.children: South Australian researchers hope vaccine in the making will silence painful ear infections

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

items.synopsis: A 17-year-old boy dies following a crash at a town near the South Australian and Victorian border last night.

title.children: Teen dies in crash near SA-Vic border

image.altText: A young man wearing black wayfarer sunglasses holds a sign that reads vive la Russia, vive la Niger

items.synopsis: Across West Africa, a sweeping popular movement shaped by anger towards France, the country's former coloniser, is gathering steam and Vladimir Putin is watching very closely.

title.children: West Africans are angry at their French colonisers. Russia is waiting in the wings

image.altText: Composite of Asian Buddhist monk, an Asian woman wearing glasses, a red flag and a row of monks.

items.synopsis: For decades, an eccentric spiritual group called Holy Tantra Esoteric Buddhism has been not just accepted but celebrated in Hobart. But now, an insider desperate to reach her son is describing the group as being like a cult.

title.children: This man claims he’s a living Buddha. Former followers say his group operates like a cult

image.altText: A house on a rural block.

items.synopsis: Police continue to investigate three suspected mushroom poisoning deaths after a family lunch last month in Leongatha in Victoria's east. Detectives have not laid any charges, but say the woman who served the meal remains a suspect. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: Three people have reportedly died in Victoria from poisonous mushrooms. What do we know so far?

image.altText: The top five finalists in the 71st Miss Universe pageant in New Orleans.

items.synopsis: Six contestants file complaints with police, accusing organisers of sexual harassment in what was meant to be a costume fitting.

title.children: Miss Universe Indonesia mired in allegations of sexual harassment and topless photos

image.altText: Australia's Hayley Raso tussles with France's Sakina Karchaoui during a football game.

items.synopsis: The Matildas need to take down France if they are to make the semifinals for the first time after Les Bleues' latest big win. Here are five things from the final round-of-16 games at the Women's World Cup.

title.children: Five quick hits — Matildas learn their quarterfinal opponent, and they're running hot

image.altText: Megan Rapinoe on a soccer field, spreading her arms wide in celebration

items.synopsis: The veteran forward's impact on sport has been profound, and her legacy will last long after she is gone.

title.children: Despite the USA's World Cup exit, Megan Rapinoe has already won

image.altText: muddy black and white dog with a police collar in the bush

items.synopsis: For those tasked with finding human bodies, the bond between specially trained cadaver dog and handler is vital — and the physical and mental exhaustion will likely be worth it, if it can bring closure to those grieving for a loved one.

title.children: Cadaver dogs are some of Australia's most specialised canines. What's involved in their training?

image.altText: An older man staring seriously at the camera

items.synopsis: A Melbourne couple had $370,000 stolen from bank accounts in a "horrific" case of identity theft. It has prompted calls for banks to sharpen up against scammers and fraudsters.

title.children: John had embarked on a family trip of a lifetime. By the time he got home, criminals had stolen his identity

image.altText: two female students carrying handbags walk through a university campus. they are facing away from the camera

items.synopsis: Reports of sexual violence appear to be going up at Australian universities, but with public reporting of data inconsistent across the sector, there are fears the full extent of the problem remains underestimated.

title.children: Calls to update university student safety survey after fears true extent of assaults remains unknown

image.altText: Dust rising off a mine site with green hills in the foreground and background

items.synopsis: The discovery of heavy metals in the blood and rainwater of those living near a gold mine in New South Wales has sent shock waves through the community and sparked a major investigation.

title.children: Major investigation into gold mine after heavy metals found in residents' blood and rainwater

image.altText: A woman in a winter coat and glasses.

items.synopsis: A woman accused of murdering her elderly parents by giving them insulin has been granted bail in the Supreme Court.

title.children: Woman accused of killing parents granted bail by Supreme Court

image.altText: A woman with light brown hair holds a baby while a blonde woman and a man wearing a suit walk beside her

items.synopsis: The partner of an Adelaide man killed in a hit-and-run crash says the driver has blood on his hands that he will never be able to wash off.

title.children: 'Nick's blood stains your hands': Partner of hit-and-run victim confronts driver in court

image.altText: Indigenous Australian holding an Aboriginal flag

items.synopsis: What will — and won't — change now the WA government has confirmed it is repealing the controversial Aboriginal Cultural Heritage Act. Jake Sturmer explains everything you need to know.

title.children: WA's controversial cultural heritage laws have been axed. So how will another Juukan Gorge disaster be avoided?

image.altText: Three Afghan Australian men point to a sign reading 'Australian Capital Territory'. Two wear Afghan and Australian flags.

items.synopsis: Almost two years after the fall of Kabul, some Afghans in Australia are struggling to help their family members, who are endangered due to their support for Australia. Three men have embarked on a gruelling walk to Canberra to make their concerns heard.

title.children: These Afghan men walked 700km in the heart of winter to deliver a heartfelt message to Canberra

image.altText: A black, grey, white and yellow illustration of woman with long black hair standing at front of a ship, with two men behind her.

items.synopsis: Behind the romantic, animated version of Pocahontas's life is a brutal reality. These people are determined to share it.

title.children: Hyper-sexualised, lied about, murdered: the real story of Pocahontas is a far cry from Disney's version

image.altText: Margot Robbie in a scene from Barbie, and Cillian Murphy in a scene from Oppenheimer.

items.synopsis: Movie tickets are nearly always the same price, whether the film is a flop or a sold-out blockbuster. Why? And how much more does a trip to the movies cost than 20 years ago? Peter Martin explains.

title.children: If Oppenheimer is an hour longer than Barbie, why are tickets to see them the same price?

image.altText: A woman in a purple top with white spots leaning on a tree and looking into the distance

items.synopsis: Sandra Deveson has waited more than four years for a mandatory inquest into the murder of her son, and has never been told when it might occur.

title.children: A 'broken system' has left Sandra still looking for answers four years after her son was murdered in jail

image.altText: The

items.synopsis: The deepest parts of the Antarctic are difficult to explore but seals have helped reveal the mysteries below, and it's a thousand metres deeper than researchers thought.

title.children: Deep-diving seals reveal clues to Antarctic ice melt

image.altText: A crowd gathering around a hearse with a picture of Sinead O'Connor on display.

items.synopsis: Thousands line the streets of Sinead O'Connor's hometown of Bray, Ireland to pay tribute to the singer before a private funeral.

title.children: 'Outpouring of love' as thousands farewell Sinead O'Connor in Ireland

items.synopsis: A man who has type 1 diabetes is calling for more awareness after being questioned about his insulin and jelly beans while trying to enter a nightclub in Adelaide's CBD.

title.children: Man claims he was questioned at nightclub for carrying insulin for his type 1 diabetes

image.altText: Scouts leave South Korea jamboree

items.synopsis: Teenagers from more than 100 countries, including over 900 Australians, have been evacuated from the World Scout Jamboree in South Korea in a logistical exercise of military-like precision.

title.children: One bus every 30 seconds: More than 37,000 teens evacuated from scout camp

image.altText: Shane walks along carrying documents and wearing sunglasses.

items.synopsis: The ACT Bar Association said outgoing Director of Public Prosecutions Shane Drumgold currently held a restricted government practising certificate that allowed him to work as a barrister in the ACT, but only while employed in the top job or for that office.

title.children: ACT Bar Association has 'grave concerns' over findings of 'serious misconduct' against outgoing top prosecutor

image.altText: Footage of a ship using a water cannon against another vessel is shown during a press conference.

items.synopsis: China asks the Philippines to tow away a grounded World War II warship from a disputed shoal after Manila rejected Beijing's earlier demand.

title.children: Grounded warship raises tensions between China, Philippines

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing a black suit and purple tie.

items.synopsis: A convicted killer is labelled a "liar" by his victim's family, with a court hearing he committed murder in 2007 and went to great lengths to cover up the crime.

title.children: 'I hope he dies in prison': Victim's family hits out at convicted murderer

image.altText: A general view picture shows houses in the Israeli settlement of Maale Adumim, in the occupied West Bank.

items.synopsis: The federal government will begin to refer to Israel's settlements in the West Bank as "illegal settlements in the occupied territories", hardening its language on the Palestinian territories.

title.children: Government to harden stance against Israel's 'illegal settlements in occupied' West Bank

image.altText: A woman in a red hat leaning on a rusty bar of a gate.

items.synopsis: Lawyers for Gina Rinehart claim a 1987 agreement shows Wright Prospecting relinquished any rights to Hancock Prospecting's Hope Downs project.

title.children: Court hears of 'fatal clauses' in Wright Prospecting's claim on Gina Rinehart's iron ore riches

image.altText: A koala sitting on the sand on a beach.

items.synopsis: Customers at a beach cafe in northern NSW were surprised to see a koala strolling along the sand in the winter sun. But its adventure has sparked concerns about habitat loss.

title.children: Rare sight of koala visiting beach delights onlookers, but wildlife carers raise concerns

image.altText: A Transport Safety Bureau investigator places recovered MRH-90 Taipan voice and flight data recorder for transport in white box

items.synopsis: The MRH90 Taipan ditched into the ocean south of Hamilton Island 10 days ago during a training exercise.

title.children: Army helicopter's black box found as search for bodies of crew continues in Whitsundays

image.altText: two men close up

items.synopsis: One Nation's NSW leader Mark Latham files his defence to a defamation action brought by independent MP Alex Greenwich.

title.children: Latham claims alleged homophobic tweets 'enhanced' Greenwich's reputation

image.altText: David Routledge kneels with two children on his knee in a bike park.

items.synopsis: David Routledge, 55, died when a high wall at Middlemount mine, south-west of Mackay, collapsed and buried him in 2019.

title.children: Mining company fined $70,000 for safety gaps after worker dies in wall collapse

image.altText: A middle-aged, bespectacled man, wearing a dark suit, walks in the sun.

items.synopsis: A remote court sitting has heard competing claims from FMG, traditional owners and the WA government amid a $500m dispute.

title.children: Federal Court judge questions value of native title laws that companies can ignore

image.altText: A sign that reads 'Broome Regional Prison' in front of a large metal gate and fence.

items.synopsis: Pressure on WA government after watchdog delivers yet another damning report into run-down Broome Prison, warning staff and inmates — male and female — face unacceptable and risky conditions.

title.children: Up to 5 weeks to see a doctor. No meaningful rehabilitation. Is this Australia's worst prison?
